Notes.Text:
This update for apache2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2022-22720: HTTP request smuggling due to incorrect error handling (bsc#1197095).
- CVE-2022-22721: possible buffer overflow with very large or unlimited LimitXMLRequestBody (bsc#1197096).

Vulnerabilities.Description: Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier fails to close inbound connection when errors are encountered discarding the request body, exposing the server to HTTP Request Smuggling

Vulnerabilities.Description: If LimitXMLRequestBody is set to allow request bodies larger than 350MB (defaults to 1M) on 32 bit systems an integer overflow happens which later causes out of bounds writes. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.
